gobblin.writer

Class FsDataWriter<D>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.writer.FsDataWriter<D>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FinalState, DataWriter<D>, Closeable, AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AvroHdfsDataWriter, HiveWritableHdfsDataWriter, SimpleDataWriter

    public abstract class FsDataWriter<D>
extends Object
implements DataWriter<D>, FinalState
    An implementation of DataWriter does the work of setting the output/staging dir and creating the FileSystem instance.

      • commit

        public void commit()
            throws IOException
        .

        This default implementation simply renames the staging file to the output file. If the output file already exists, it will delete it first before doing the renaming.

        Specified by:
        commit in interface DataWriter<D>
        Throws:
        IOException - if any file operation fails

      • cleanup

        public void cleanup()
             throws IOException
        .

        This default implementation simply deletes the staging file if it exists.

        Specified by:
        cleanup in interface DataWriter<D>
        Throws:
        IOException - if deletion of the staging file fails
